ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] ck2cti - problems converting mechanism
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, The previous versions of Cantera did seem to give troubles converting mechanisms when all three files (including transport mechanism) were included..but

Subject: Re: [cantera] ck2cti - problems converting mechanism
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=228646714; y=94GV8tgbW2L7q2bVkwf7VLU4Xsy-loBoGFH215LnfS_lA8OA6gZCilVonh4

Hi,

The previous versions of Cantera did seem to give troubles 
converting mechanisms when all three files (including transport 
mechanism) were included..but the file conversion should run if 
you use only input mechanism and thermo files..In any case, the 
latest version doesn't have such a problem anymore.

There are actually a lot of ways of converting your mechanisms..
Matlab function: ck2cti.m,
Python module: ck2cti.py,
Mixmaster GUI

all of these run a dos command to run the ck2cti.exe file that 
sits in the Cantera\bin folder

I generally run the dos command on the file to convert 
mechanisms..
Here's what the syntax should look like

C:\your path\my documents\Cantera\bin\>ck2cti -i inputfile.dat -t 
thermo.dat -tr trans.dat

I realised for problems like these, there isn't sufficient 
documentation..but if you look for the functions you are working 
with in different interfaces..you can learn from the comments put 
in the program..

Check out these folders..
Cantera\Matlab\toolbox
C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera
C:\Documents and Settings\---\My 
Documents\Cantera\include\cantera\kernel

For example here are the comments in ck2cti.py file..which does 
talk about idtag..

Convert a Chemkin-format input file to CTI format.
Parameters:

infile - name of the Chemkin-format input file.

thermodb - Thermodynamic database. This may be a standard
           Chemkin-format thermo database, or may be any
           Chemkin-format input file containing a THERMO section.

trandb - Transport database. File containing species transport
         parameters in Chemkin format. If this argument is 
omitted,
         the CTI file will not contain transport property 
information.

idtag - ID tag. Used to identify the ideal_gas entry in the CTI 
file. Optional.

debug - If set to 1, extra debugging output will be written. This
        should only be used if ck2cti fails, in order to view
        intermediate output of the parser. Default: off (0).

validate - If set to 1, the mechanism will be checked for errors. 
This
           is recommended, but for very large mechanisms may slow 
down
           the conversion process. Default: on (1).

If you still have troubles converting your mechanism. Feel free to 
contact me, I can convert them for you.

Bhupinder


On Fri Dec 02 18:10:06 EST 2005, storeybd <brian.storey@...> 
wrote:

> Hello:
> 
> I am having trouble getting the ck2cti utility to work. I seem to 
> be
> running into two problems.
> 
> 1) When I run with all three input files, the program seems to 
> run
> fine, the log file says that the program has been successful and 
> I can
> see that it has processed the reactions and the thermodynamic 
> data,
> but I get no output. The program just sits there and does not 
> return
> the output data or the command prompt. 2) The mechanism that I am 
> most interested in using does not have transport data (I don't 
> need it). The program seems to crash when the
> transport file is not included. If I check the log file it 
> appears
> that everything up through the thermo data and the mechanism is
> successful. Is there a way to force the program to not need the
> transport data?  Any thoughts on why this is crashing?
> 
> Finally, I cannot find in the help what is meant by the option 
> -id
> <identifier>. I am not using this option so perhaps that is my 
> problem. As a test, I have been trying to convert the mechanisms 
> given by
> livermore as a test and have been unsuccessful with them all. 
> http://www-cms.llnl.gov/combustion/combustion2.html
> 
> If anyone has any advice, I would be most grateful. Brian-
>
